page.title: 09Schools.
page.content: The first school to be built in Crynant was established in 1857 by the 'National Society for Promoting the Education of the Poor in the Principles of the Established Church throughout England and Wales'. The method of teaching was based on the cheap monitorial system, education in the Three R's and Religious Education depended on the payment of a weekly fee, those who couldn't pay weren't taught. All instruction was in English with Welsh being resorted to only when the subject was too difficult to understand. A new, larger school was built in 1907 with the older children later transferring to a separate school in 1912. The infant and junior schools were recently amalgamated into a primary school in 1982.
